data.title: The Best PG-13 Comedies of All Time
data.meta_description: Over 15K filmgoers have voted on the 110+ films on Best PG-13 Comedies of All Time. Current Top 3: Happy Gilmore, Ferris Bueller's Day Off, Pitch Perfect ...
data.text:
PG-13 comedies are a popular genre for moviegoers, striking a balance between humor and broad appeal. The narratives of these films hover between all-ages fun for everyone and the edgier humor that tween, teen, and older audiences crave, offering a delightful mix that draws viewers back time and again. From slapstick antics to witty banter, PG-13 comedy movies offer a world where laughter is a given. That makes them a staple of weekend movie marathons and late-night laughs. Whether it’s the timeless charm of 1980s classics or modern-day hilarity, the greatest of these films provide a mix of laughs and uplifting moments perfect for any occasion.

Good PG-13 movies have changed throughout the ages. These PG-13-rated films used to include nudity, but in recent years you will find that the Hollywood pros behind hilarious PG13 movies (along with horror movies and action flicks) were looking to get a more marketable rating, rather than limiting potential audiences and potentially limiting sales in theaters and rentals with a more restrictive category. With the evolving film landscape we're in now, the newest trends could easily shift again. So what makes PG-13 comedy releases stand out? Well, it's got to be funny of course, then it should also not be squeaky clean with have an edge that make it inappropriate for family viewing. The funniest PG-13 movies ever ride the R-rating line really carefully while still just being good PG-13 movies.

Take for instance Happy Gilmore, an instant classic with Adam Sandler in peak comedic form. Directed by Dennis Dugan, this film combines slapstick humor with a heartwarming storyline. It’s not just Sandler’s endearing portrayal of a failed hockey player-turned-golfer that charms viewers, but also the colorful supporting characters who elevate the comedic stakes. Moving to the 1980s, Ferris Bueller's Day Off by John Hughes captures the spirit of youthful rebellion and carefree adventure. Matthew Broderick’s Ferris is the lovable rogue who convinces his friends to play hooky, creating a day of non-stop fun and mischief. These films - and others like them - highlight why PG-13 comedies deliver accessible yet sharp humor.

These comedies are all awesome, and they also happen to be rated PG-13. Many genre bending options like romantic comedies, action comedies, or horror comedies also share the rating (and are incredibly fun to watch as well). If you're looking for less edge, check out the Best Comedy Movies of All Time. Also, take a look at which comedies are currently streaming on Netflix and Amazon Prime.

If you think your favorite PG-13 comedy movie isn't as high on the list as it should be, vote it up so it can take its rightful place among the other great PG-13 comedy films on this list. If you're trying to find a specific PG-13 comedy film but don't see it, you can search this list and filter to find what you're looking for.

Examples of movies on this list: Forrest Gump, Ferris Bueller's Day Off, and many more.

If you're trying to find out "What are the best PG-13 comedies?" and "What are the most famous PG-13 comedies?" then this list is the perfect resource for you. Use this list if you're looking for some new comedies that are rated PG-13. Between Netflix, Hulu and other services there are thousands of great comedies rated PG-13, so get out there and start watching.
